Material used.Description: The study involved analyzing DNA from individuals with known AAT mutations.

Readout description.Result Description: The S-type mutation was associated with reduced AAT functionality.
The Z-type mutation led to a significant reduction in AAT levels.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple biological replicates were performed to validate the findings.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was conducted in triplicate for technical consistency.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type AAT DNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: DNA from non-deficient individuals was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Descriptive statistics were used to analyze the data.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: AAT levels above 120 mg/dL are considered normal.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: AAT levels below 35 mg/dL indicate deficiency.
